name: NPR
text:
A bipartisan group of ex-public officials is launching a $20 million public education campaign to highlight the safety and security of the upcoming election — even amid President Trump's efforts to discredit the outcome.
https://t.co/pRJx7hYDyu

name: NPR
text:
Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis, who has refused to issue a statewide mask mandate, is squaring off with city and county leaders. He says local governments can require masks — but they can't enforce that with fines.
https://t.co/LuZFzHYZ9e

name: NPR
text:
Here are 5 questions to consider ahead of the #VPDebate tonight.

name: NPR
text:
This year's MacArthur Fellows — recipients of what's commonly called the Genius Grant — include filmmakers, scientists, dancers, scholars and more.

They'll each receive a no-strings-attached $625,000 award.
https://t.co/KhcVjYbrk1

name: NPR
text: As the White House and Democratic lawmakers continue to clash, the pandemic continues, millions can't afford food, and help doesn't appear to be on the way. Today on #NPRConsiderThis, we look at this growing demand and some potential solutions. https://t.co/QaXwHnjaNB

name: NPR
text:
California has implemented a new requirement for its biggest counties: To advance to the next phase of economic reopening, they will need to reduce the levels of coronavirus in their most vulnerable communities.
https://t.co/p6tfkG786y

name: NPR
text: RT @nprpolitics: Live: Listen To The Vice Presidential Debate https://t.co/QPfzDXmku5

name: NPR
text:
JUST IN: The Trump administration is asking the Supreme Court to allow it to end 2020 census counting early after a lower court ruled it must keep counting through Oct. 31 to give more time for accuracy.
 https://t.co/Ti1LDhyZWE

name: NPR
text:
Kamala Harris and Mike Pence are facing off in the first and only vice presidential debate of the election.

Join us for live analysis and fact-checks. #VPDebate
